Node.Notes: Uncertain. See Cranfield's ICC commentary on 8 possibilities. Some manuscripts have God. Options include God (either expressed or implied), the Spirit, or all things as subject.
Grounds the main proposition in v. 28, that all things work together for good: all things conspire for good because of God’s sovereign rule and plan for believers.

Node.FrameGloss: {A0:did ~ spare;gave him up, A1:all things A2:to us}

Node.Notes: Assumes: Shall tribulation or distress ... separate us from Christ's love? Just as it is written ... (citation of ps44:22 establishes that believers are not exempt from the sufferings listed).
